Comment 6: 
Russ,

I think your understanding is wrong.

http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms686331

See description for STARTF_USESTDHANDLES flag:

>>>
The hStdInput, hStdOutput, and hStdError members contain additional information.

If this flag is specified when calling one of the process creation functions, the
handles must be inheritable and the function's bInheritHandles parameter must be set to
TRUE. ...
<<<

I did tried setting bInheritHandles=false anyway, and now I can't read new process
stdout from parent process. So, I suspect, it works as advertised.

Alex
